```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
```

## Do something simple

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 3)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)
```

I want a function to compute z-score

```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least three numbers")
  }
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(x_vec)
```

Try my function on some other thing: These should give errors

```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores(3)
z_scores("my name is kaitlyn")
z_scores(mtcars)
z_scores(c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE))
```

## Multiple outputs

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least three numbers")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  tibble(
    mean = mean_x,
    sd = sd_x
  )
  
}

```

Check that the function works

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(100, mean = 3, sd = 4)
mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## Multiple inputs

I'd like to do this with a function

```{r}
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(100, mean = 4, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data %>% 
  summarise(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )

```


```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(sample_size, mu = 3, sigma = 4) {
  
  sim_data = 
    tibble(
      x = rnorm(sample_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
    )

  sim_data %>% 
    summarise(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
    )

}

sim_mean_sd(100, 6, 3)
sim_mean_sd(100)
```
